intro: Scirpus palustromicrocarpus, commonly known as the small-fruited bulrush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and shallow water areas. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of flowers. Its rhizomes help it spread and establish dense colonies in moist soils. Scirpus palustromicrocarpus plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland habitats and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
